page.title: 06WIRE-MAKING
page.content: {The Wire Industry In Warrington { }Many people in other parts of England know Warrington for its rugby league team, whose nickname is The Wires. This name derives from the wire industry, which today is based in the firms of Rylands and Longford. Longford was founded in 1874 and now employs a workforce of about 80. The firm produces its wire from metal rods which are imported from countries such as Spain, Portugal, Germany and Czechoslovakia. They make various kinds of wire, including spring wire, rope wire, cable, reinforcing wire and rivet wire. The wire costs between Â£200 and Â£800 per 1000 kilos. Longford export the wire to America, Canada and Southern Ireland but most is sold in Britain. It is surprising that there are no exports to Europe.
